definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: Captain Aoyagi, the company commander, was killed while he directed the defense.
sentences.chinese: 連隊指揮官，青柳上尉，在直接參加防禦戰時陣亡。

sentences.english: A captain commands a company or battery.
sentences.chinese: 一個上尉指揮一個連隊或炮兵連。

sentences.english: This is a heroic company which fought on many fronts in the Liberation War.
sentences.chinese: 這是一支解放戰爭中經過南征北戰的英雄連隊。

sentences.english: His late night rescues Wei Gang, 2 people escape a company.
sentences.chinese: 他深夜救出魏剛，二人逃回連隊。

sentences.english: You asked me what type of SMG we used in our company.
sentences.chinese: 你問我在連隊裏我們用什麼型號的衝鋒槍。

sentences.english: Wray made his way back to the company area to report on what he had seen.
sentences.chinese: 沃伊中尉摸索回到連隊所在地段，彙報所見所聞。

sentences.english: We spent the day together talking and enjoying each other's company.
sentences.chinese: 我們花了一整天談論和分享彼此連隊裏發生的事情。

sentences.english: The company commander has received order from the General Staff that his company would move to the front.
sentences.chinese: 連長接到參謀部的命令說他的連隊要開往前線。

sentences.english: Just was allocated to company stallion of stallion class feed.
sentences.chinese: 剛到連隊就被分配到種馬班餵養種馬。

sentences.english: That morning, the company arranged a great banquet to send us off.
sentences.chinese: 這天早晨，爲了歡送我們，連隊大排宴席。

sentences.english: The company was numbered off by the sergeant major.
sentences.chinese: 軍士長下令讓連隊報數。

sentences.english: This is a heroic company which fought on many fronts in the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 這是一支抗日戰爭中經過南征北戰的英雄連隊。

sentences.english: Guangxi, Beihai's Female Militia Company has a fine tradition of being a militia group.
sentences.chinese: 廣西北海地角女民兵連是個有着優良傳統的民兵連隊。

sentences.english: The garrison belongs to a unit of the People's Liberation Army stationed in the downtown area of Chongqing.
sentences.chinese: 駐軍屬中國人民解放軍駐重慶城區的一個連隊。

sentences.english: Leeds and Australia star Marc Viduka on the importance of winning.
sentences.chinese: 利茲連隊和澳大利亞球星維杜卡闡述勝利的重要性。

definition: War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
wing (of an air force)/sports team representing a combination of entities (e.g. United Korea)
Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies
